headline.print_headline: Geithner's Memoir Blasts Kirk's Comments in China
headline.main: Geithner's Memoir Blasts Kirk's Comments in China

docs.snippet: In his new memoir out Monday, former U.S. Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner blasts U.S. Sen. Mark Kirk of Illinois for "delusional" comments he allegedly made to Chinese officials about U.S. debt while a congressman in 2009....
docs.lead_paragraph: In his new memoir out Monday, former U.S. Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner blasts U.S. Sen. Mark Kirk of Illinois for "delusional" comments he allegedly made to Chinese officials about U.S. debt while a congressman in 2009.

headline.print_headline: Honoring Cops, Obama Says US Owes Police a Debt
headline.main: Honoring Cops, Obama Says US Owes Police a Debt

docs.snippet: The United States owes a debt to the police officers who put themselves in danger to protect the nation, President Barack Obama said Monday as he honored the nation's top police officers at the White House....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States owes a debt to the police officers who put themselves in danger to protect the nation, President Barack Obama said Monday as he honored the nation's top police officers at the White House.

headline.print_headline: FCC Revising Internet Rules After Public Backlash
headline.main: FCC Revising Internet Rules After Public Backlash

docs.snippet: Federal Communications Commission Chairman Tom Wheeler is broadening the scope of his proposed open Internet rules and suggesting tougher standards for Internet providers who wish to create paid priority fast lanes on their networks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal Communications Commission Chairman Tom Wheeler is broadening the scope of his proposed open Internet rules and suggesting tougher standards for Internet providers who wish to create paid priority fast lanes on their networks.

headline.print_headline: AT&T Courts Satellite TV With an Eye on Growth
headline.main: AT&T Courts Satellite TV With an Eye on Growth

docs.snippet: AT&T is in talks to buy DirecTV for at least $50 billion, and the two sides are actively working toward an announcement, according to several people with knowledge of the matter....
docs.abstract: AT&T is in talks to buy DirecTV for at least $50 billion, and the two sides are actively working toward an announcement, according to several people with knowledge of the matter.

headline.print_headline: QPR Edge Wigan in Extra Time to Reach Playoff Final
headline.main: QPR Edge Wigan in Extra Time to Reach Playoff Final

docs.snippet: Charlie Austin scored twice including the extra-time winner to drag Queens Park Rangers into the English Championship (second tier) playoff final after a 2-1 comeback victory against Wigan Athletic on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Charlie Austin scored twice including the extra-time winner to drag Queens Park Rangers into the English Championship (second tier) playoff final after a 2-1 comeback victory against Wigan Athletic on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Brothers Are Found Guilty of Hiding Trades Through Trusts
headline.main: Texas Brothers Are Found Liable on Hiding Trades Through Trusts

docs.snippet: A jury in Manhattan federal court found that the Samuel and Charles Wyly Jr. had committed fraud by creating a web of offshore trusts that netted them $550 million in illegal trading profits....
docs.abstract: A jury in Manhattan federal court found that the Samuel and Charles Wyly Jr. had committed fraud by creating a web of offshore trusts that netted them $550 million in illegal trading profits.

headline.print_headline: As Elections Near, Polls Show Europeans Feel Disconnected From Brussels
headline.main: As Elections Near, Polls Show Europeans Feel Disconnected From Brussels

docs.snippet: With just over a week to go until European Parliament elections, two separate polls on Monday suggested around two-thirds of Europeans feel their voices are not heard in Brussels, although trust in the European Union is rebounding from record lows...
docs.lead_paragraph: With just over a week to go until European Parliament elections, two separate polls on Monday suggested around two-thirds of Europeans feel their voices are not heard in Brussels, although trust in the European Union is rebounding from record lows.

headline.print_headline: London Imam Claims at U.S. Trial He Tried to Help Yemen Hostages
headline.main: London Imam Claims at U.S. Trial He Tried to Help Yemen Hostages

docs.snippet: London imam Abu Hamza admitted to a U.S. jury on Monday that he provided a satellite phone to Yemeni militants months before they kidnapped Western tourists in 1998 and spoke to their leader just three hours after the hostages were taken....
docs.lead_paragraph: London imam Abu Hamza admitted to a U.S. jury on Monday that he provided a satellite phone to Yemeni militants months before they kidnapped Western tourists in 1998 and spoke to their leader just three hours after the hostages were taken.

headline.print_headline: Ferdinand the Rock of Ferguson's Second Coming
headline.main: Ferdinand the Rock of Ferguson's Second Coming

docs.snippet: Manchester United had to sign Rio Ferdinand after the 2002 World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester United had to sign Rio Ferdinand after the 2002 World Cup.

headline.print_headline: 4 Defendants Back Together in Blackwater Case
headline.main: 4 Defendants Back Together in Blackwater Case

docs.snippet: A judge is placing four former Blackwater Worldwide guards together in a trial that is scheduled to begin on June 11 in the killings of 14 Iraqi civilians and the injuring of at least 18 others in Baghdad....
docs.lead_paragraph: A judge is placing four former Blackwater Worldwide guards together in a trial that is scheduled to begin on June 11 in the killings of 14 Iraqi civilians and the injuring of at least 18 others in Baghdad.
